ENGLISH: Yes, definitely.  Patients with an allergic reaction to pollen/dust/paint/etc should not be allergic to the vaccine.  If you suspect that you are allergic to the vaccine, you can tell the doctor or nurse at the vaccination center about your allergy history.  People with allergies should also get vaccinated.  You will be monitored at the vaccination center for 15 minutes after vaccination and will be provided with all medications to deal with any vaccine related allergic reactions.

ENGLISH: Some mild symptoms such as fever up to 99.5F, headache, body ache, feeling weakness and fatigue, pain at the site of injection are common for 2-3 days after vaccination. You can take tablet paracetamol 500/650mg (crocin/ dolo/ calpol/ pacimol) up to 3 times a day to relieve such symptoms. If they persist for more than 2-3 days (especially fever), and if the fever is 101F or higher, get checked by a doctor in person.

ENGLISH: All vaccinations in India are facilitated by the government's CoWIN platform. You should receive an SMS confirming your vaccination and you can also download the vaccination certificate from the CoWIN system. CoWIN can link each registered mobile number with up to 4 beneficiaries. The vaccination camp is responsible for providing print certificates to all the beneficiaries. ENGLISH: COVID-19 vaccines teach your long-term immunity to fight disease. The body's immune system is capable of sustaining this training for at least 6-9 months to a few years. However, COVID is a rapidly evolving disease, and new variants are emerging everyday. All vaccines so far certified for use in India offer some degree of protection against all variants. We may have to get an updated booster vaccine in the future, but only time will tell.

ENGLISH: There have been a few trials of mixing vaccines. The studies have largely focused on taking a second dose of mRNA vaccine like Pfizer or Moderna after taking an initial dose of other vaccines, largely Oxford Astra-Zeneca. It is generally safe to take two doses of different vaccines, like for example first dose of Oxford Astra-Zeneca and second dose of Moderna. However, any such mixing of the vaccine should be done after taking the input of a medical professional.
